intro: Axinaea floribunda, commonly known as the pink bellflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a distinctive purple or red throat. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species, many of which are known for their ornamental value. Axinaea floribunda typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with opposite, elliptic leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers bloom in clusters, making it a striking addition to shaded garden environments.
